Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the number of people lost to gun violence in the US by stating that "no other country comes even close" to the nearly 40,000 deaths.
Understate: The claim understates the number of firearm-related deaths in other countries by falsely claiming that no other country has as many firearm-related deaths as the US.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide evidence or data to back up the statement that no other country comes close to the number of gun deaths in the US.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that the number of gun deaths is the sole indicator of the severity of gun violence in a country, without considering other factors such as gun control policies or population size.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the fact that there are other countries, such as Brazil and Mexico, that have higher firearm injury death rates than the US.
